data.title: Great bar
data.text: My wife and I come here all the time. The food is great and reasonably priced. All the bartenders are cool and keep the drinks coming. I would suggest this place to anyone who wants to just chill out and have a beer and a burger!!!

data.title: Louie's on Main - Garden Grove
data.text: Fast friendly service - welcoming environment -  food is not bad at all.  Takes a bit of time for the food during lunch hour to get to you; Decide quickly and you will be fine. Beer menu changes regularly.  Always a good time.

data.title: Very Good Bar Food
data.text: The food at Louie's was very good. The service was friendly and quick. We would definitely recommend this place. A great bar to visit away from the busy atmosphere of the Disney strip.

data.title: Great selection of Craft Beers
data.text:
Louie's on Main is the best Pub in garden grove, friendly staff and they know about the different craft beer that they are selling.
For such a tinny kitchen they put out great food, love their Humus and Pita, real local meeting place.With loads of parking out back.

data.title: Great Little Pub
data.text: Louie's never changes, always been great, still is.  Friendly, neighborhood pub with great food and drink.  Chicken Salad is excellent, not the usual - this one has specialty greens with freshly grilled chicken breast on top.  Steak sandwich is a winner.  Good selection on both food and beverage menus.  They pour a good Guinness.  Great place to grab a quick or relaxed lunch or dinner or late night.

data.title: Local flavor at this local bar
data.text:
I love this bar; it's my kind of place. Just walking through the front door puts a big smile on my face. 

Louie's is a Garden Grove institution. Located on historic Main Street, you will see all kinds of locals gather at this watering hole. The drink specials are great, with many beers on draft. The food is also good, and reasonably priced. 

There are so many craft brews on draft, and range from $4-7 a pint. They rotate quite often, so there's always something new to try. Be aware of the specials they may have (the green sticker shows which beers are on special), and during the week they have set promotions such as Monday get a beer half price with any burger. Breakfast here on the weekends are good, and during the brunch hours you can get a bottomless mimosa for $10. 

The servers are on top of things, and are quick to get you whatever you need. The housemade ranch dressing is so good, use it on your fries, onion rings, everything. The kids menu is also good, especially the chicken fingers. 

It's not a fancy place, but it is full of fun, food, laughter, and good times.

data.title: great food and drink
data.text: I had the Burger, good portion, excellent beef patty, came with Onion rings, I love the place, super clean, huge craft beer selection, Wing specials on tues, all around great place, staff super attentive

data.title: Nice pub in historic downtown area
data.text: My family fell in love with their Chipotle Steak Sandwich.  So good we went twice during our short stay.  Awesome burgers, onion rings, and beer selection. Good food at a good price.

data.title: Great service, great food and reasonably priced.
data.text:
I was looking for a place open late after we left Disneyland. I saw good reviews on yelp so we checked it out.

We got there 10 minutes before the kitchen closed and the bartender was very gracious, seated us and treated us great the whole time.  The place is a bar with a kitchen and booths across the back wall, so it’s not really a family spot, but the food was excellent (BBQ burger and onion rings were killer) and it’s reasonably priced.  I think our party of 4 ate for about $40.

Since the kitchen was closing, it was just the bartender serving and handling refills.  He was on top of it and we all left very happy.  We had a great experience at Louie’s on Main.

data.title: Nice bar and good food.
data.text: The bar staff are feiendly and helpfull, the food is of good quility and good potions, This is one of the few places open after midnight, it is trouble free and a good place where you can relax.

data.title: A Great Surprise
data.text: So today I went to a retirement party for a coworker and we met at Louie's in Downtown Garden Grove. I have only eaten at a couple of the restaurants on Main Street and so far none have disappointed. Louie's pretty much has a small menu but from what everyone was eating, including me, the food was delicious! I had the BBQ Chicken wrap and it was huge! Tons of filling in the flour tortilla and the BBQ ranch dressing they give on the side was really good. It's a little bit on the expensive side for lunch, but with the big portions and the quality of the food, it was worth it. If you're on a budget, it's not someplace you could go to often, but for special occasions it's the perfect place. I really enjoyed it here!

data.title: AWESOME NEIGHBORHOOD BAR!!!
data.text: This is such a great little hot spot!  Fantastic drinks and food!  Ideal if you are in town and want a quick bite, after work for a quick drink with co-workers or for dinner with the family.  you shouldn't leave Garden Grove, without stopping at this fantastic little restaurant/bar!!
